member.name: T:Dysnomia.Common.BlizzardWebAPI.Diablo3Community
member.summary: Diablo III community APIs provide endpoints for Diablo III player profiles. https://develop.battle.net/documentation/diablo-3/community-apis

member.name: M:Dysnomia.Common.BlizzardWebAPI.Diablo3Community.GetImage(Dysnomia.Common.BlizzardWebAPI.Enums.Diablo3ImageType,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get image URL from type, size and icon in blizzard CDN. Warning: this CDN only supports HTTP, not HTTPS
member.param: The image type (items or skills)
The size: for items must either be small or large; for skills must be 21, 42, or 64 (These values refer to the image size in pixels).
Icon name without extension

member.name: M:Dysnomia.Common.BlizzardWebAPI.Diablo3Community.GetActIndex(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns an index of acts.
member.param: Client credential flow access token
The region of the data to retrieve.
The locale to reflect in localized data.

member.name: T:Dysnomia.Common.BlizzardWebAPI.ILegacyStarcraft2Community
member.summary: See https://develop.battle.net/documentation/starcraft-2/community-apis, under "Legacy API"

member.name: M:Dysnomia.Common.BlizzardWebAPI.ILegacyStarcraft2Community.GetPlayerProfile(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Retrieves data about an individual Starcraft2 profile.
member.param: Credential Code Flow access token

StarCraft II community APIs use the region parameter to set the host region in the Try It feature. Note: {region} does not affect StarCraft II responses, which use the :regionId parameter in requests.
You can retrieve these parameters by issuing a GetPlayerAccount request.
You can retrieve these parameters by issuing a GetPlayerAccount request.
You can retrieve these parameters by issuing a GetPlayerAccount request.

member.name: M:Dysnomia.Common.BlizzardWebAPI.TokenQuerier.GetClientCredentialFlow
member.summary: The OAuth client credentials flow is used to exchange a pair of client credentials (client_id and client_secret) for an access token. https://develop.battle.net/documentation/guides/using-oauth/client-credentials-flow

member.name: M:Dysnomia.Common.BlizzardWebAPI.TokenQuerier.GetAuthorizationCodeFlow(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The OAuth 2.0 Authorization Code Flow allows an application to access a user's data on their behalf. This allows an application to acquire more sensitive, opt-in information about a user, such as their list of World of Warcraft characters, after obtaining the user's permission to do so. The Authorization Code Flow has two major parts: the authorization code request and the access token request. https://develop.battle.net/documentation/guides/using-oauth/authorization-code-flow
member.param: The previously-retrieved authorization_code.
The scopes needed for the access token. Note that this can be fewer scopes than the authorization.
